title: Gates Cambridge Scholarship
description: The Gates Cambridge Scholarship offers full-cost scholarships to outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK to pursue a full-time postgraduate degree at the University of Cambridge. It focuses on academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to improving the lives of others.
requirements: Applicants must be non-UK citizens applying for a full-time postgraduate degree at the University of Cambridge. Strong academic record, leadership ability, and a commitment to social improvement are essential.
funding: Full tuition, stipend, travel, and visa costs

title: Fulbright Foreign Student Program - Master's in Data Science
description:
The Fulbright Foreign Student Program enables graduate students, young professionals and artists from abroad to study and conduct research in the United States. The Program funds over 4,000 foreign students each year to pursue master's or doctoral degree programs at U.S. universities.

This scholarship covers full tuition, living expenses, health insurance, and round-trip airfare for study in the United States. Recipients join a diverse cohort of emerging leaders from around the world and gain access to the Fulbright alumni network of over 400,000 individuals worldwide.

The program emphasizes leadership development, cultural exchange, and building lasting connections between the United States and other countries. Students participate in enrichment activities including conferences, cultural events, and community service opportunities.

Priority fields include STEM subjects, particularly those addressing global challenges such as climate change, public health, food security, and sustainable developmen
requirements: This scholarship covers full tuition, living expenses, health insurance, and round-trip airfare for study in the United States. Recipients join a diverse cohort of emerging leaders from around the world and gain access to the Fulbright alumni network of over 400,000 individuals worldwide.

title: Schwarzman Scholars Program
description: A fully-funded, one-year master's program at Tsinghua University in Beijing designed to prepare future global leaders. Students pursue studies in Global Affairs with concentrations in Public Policy, Economics, or International Studies.
requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, strong leadership potential, English proficiency. Open to all nationalities under 29 years old at the time of enrollment.
funding: Full tuition, room and board, in-country travel, stipend, and airfare

title: Chevening Scholarship
description: The UK Government’s global scholarship program offers fully funded one-year master’s degrees at any UK university for outstanding emerging leaders from around the world.
requirements: Applicants must be citizens of Chevening-eligible countries, hold an undergraduate degree, and have at least two years of work experience. Return home for a minimum of two years after the award.
funding: Full tuition, living allowance, return flights, and visa fees

title: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master’s Scholarships
description: A prestigious, fully funded European Union program supporting international students to pursue joint master’s degrees offered by consortia of European universities in multiple countries.
requirements: Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree and apply to a selected Erasmus Mundus Joint Master’s program. Open to all nationalities.
funding: Full tuition, travel, installation allowance, and monthly stipend

title: DAAD Helmut Schmidt Programme – Public Policy and Good Governance
description: The DAAD Helmut Schmidt Programme offers full scholarships for master’s programs in public policy, governance, and development at German universities. It targets future leaders committed to social justice and good governance.
requirements: Bachelor’s degree, proven experience in social/political engagement, and strong motivation for public service. Open to graduates from developing and transition countries.
funding: Full tuition, monthly stipend, travel allowance, and health insurance

title: Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program
description: Knight-Hennessy Scholars is a fully funded graduate-level scholarship at Stanford University, supporting students from all disciplines who demonstrate leadership, innovation, and civic commitment.
requirements: Applicants must apply to a full-time graduate program at Stanford and separately to the Knight-Hennessy Scholars program. All nationalities eligible.
funding: Full tuition, living stipend, and travel allowance

title: Aga Khan Foundation International Scholarship Programme
description: The Aga Khan Foundation provides limited numbers of scholarships each year for postgraduate studies to outstanding students from developing countries who have no other means of financing their education.
requirements: Excellent academic record, genuine financial need, and admission to a reputable postgraduate program. Preference for students under 30 years old.
funding: 50% grant and 50% loan for tuition and living expenses

title: Rotary Peace Fellowship
description: The Rotary Peace Fellowship funds master’s degree programs related to peace and development at leading universities worldwide. Fellows develop practical skills to promote peace and resolve conflict globally.
requirements: Bachelor’s degree, minimum three years of relevant work experience, and a strong commitment to peace and international understanding.
funding: Full tuition, room and board, transportation, and internship expenses

title: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)
description: The Swedish Institute offers full scholarships for global professionals to study master’s programs in Sweden. It targets future leaders contributing to sustainable development in their home countries.
requirements: Applicants must be from eligible countries, have work experience, and demonstrate leadership and motivation for sustainable development.
funding: Full tuition, living expenses, insurance, and travel grant

title: Clarendon Fund Scholarship – University of Oxford
description: The Clarendon Fund offers over 150 full scholarships annually for graduate students at the University of Oxford. It covers any subject area and recognizes academic excellence and leadership potential.
requirements: Apply for a graduate degree at Oxford by the relevant January deadline. Selection is based on academic merit and potential.
funding: Full tuition and generous living allowance
